message:
Hi Geeks,
I asked what if you have an idea for Startup.
this idea has been already exist, but you will make it in different way with different revenue stream.
is this situation good to start or not ?

data.message:
^ exactly!!
build the mvp as fast as possible
test on a random group of the target audience
make the fixes
deploy!
as fast as possible

you don't want to wake up some day on the breaking news "folan had made sth amazing" which was your idea in the first place
you really don't
Don't focus on Ideas. Focus on Solving problems People don't pay for Ideas they Pay for a Solution to their problems.

Don't be too emotionally attached to the idea.

If the idea exists, this is almost always a good thing. It provides market validation. It tells you that people are willing to pay for it.

If you come up with an idea that no one tried before, it's more likely that others found it bad rather than that you are the first person ever to come up with it.

That leads me to the opening statement. You'll learn a lot of thing building what the idea is about. It may succeed and you'll learn more, and you might apply the learning to other ideas afterwards.

It may fail, and then you'll also apply the learning to another idea and try again. You've already learned something about market validation and fear of other ideas by reading these comments.
+++++1 for Mohamed Meligy Comment. Don't get emotionally attached to the idea.
